intro: Hieracium mesopoliotrichum, commonly known as the purple hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of ray florets that range from yellow to purple. Hieracium mesopoliotrichum is often found in temperate regions and can be a common weed in agricultural areas.
